basics.name: Justin Loi
basics.label: DevSecOps Engineer
basics.summary: I am a recent graduate, holding a BS in Computer Science and a minor in Business Administration. Committed to continuous learning and innovation, I possess a diverse skill set and experiences in software engineering, machine learning/artificial intelligence, and DevOps. Notably, I excel in effectively communicating with cross-functional teams and customers to ensure seamless collaboration and project success.

courses: Funadementals: Algorithms, Machine-Level and Systems Programming, Operating Systems, Data Networks, Software Engineering II
Cybersecurity: Software Reverse Engineering, Software Quality Assurance
BUS 310: Statistic Analysis for Business Decisions
BUS 311: Information Systems for Global Business Environment
BUS 315: Global Management and Organizational Behavior

work.summary: From a DevSecOps intern to a DevSecOps Engineer working with various teams in Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services
highlights: Managed AWS cloud infrastructure for 3 Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) teams, ensuring continued support using Terragrunt and Terraform modules.

Oversaw 8 AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) clusters, optimizing cluster configurations such as Istio, ArgoCD, Flux and other configurations to ensure high availability, performance, and security across all clusters.

Enhanced operational visibility and analytics by configuring and managing Splunk, Grafana, Loki, and Prometheus, leading to a 25% reduction in incident response time and improved real-time analytics for key stakeholders.
Implemented automated solutions to address key stakeholders pain points, including monitoring additional critical services, managing changes to database schemas, and ensuring email relay compliance.

work.summary: Software Engineer doing analysis on vulnerabilities
highlights: Developed predictive models using MediaPipe’s Text Embedding and Sentence2Vec to assess vulnerabilities’ impact on integrity, confidentiality, and automability.
Applied machine learning techniques to predict the mapping of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) to Common Weakness Enumerations (CWE).
Conducted in-depth analysis and evaluation of Text Embedding and Sentence2Vec models for vulnerability assessment, contributing to the advancement of cybersecurity methodologies.
Developed an Azure PowerShell script to optimize VM provisioning and resource management based on assigned tags, leveraging Azure DevOps Function App to auto-tag new VMs efficiently.
Spearheaded the successful upgrade of jQuery library to version 3.6.0 on 7 web portal, resulting in improved portals’ security and performance.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills by refactoring both in-house and third-party plugins, ensuring full compatibility with jQuery 3.6.0.
Enhanced the student resource mobile application ”ManoaNow” with over 1,000 downloads, actively enhancing its features and functionality to ensure a seamless user experience.
Managed Manoa Now and its 4 associated organizations’ BLOX Content Management System-hosted website, ensuring smooth functionality and up-to-date content.
Handled passwords and credentials management and provided troubleshooting assistance to staff members.
Maintained Lanakila Health Center’s network of 30 Windows 7/10 computers.
Facilitated the configuration and installation of Lanakila Health Center’s network of 30 Windows 11 computers.
Troubleshot software, hardware, and networking issues.
Implemented user interface designs from Figma to the minimum viable product (MVP) mobile application.
Contributed feedback about the design of the minimum viable product’s user interface.
Operate the cash register (in-store and drive-thru) and ring up customer purchases.
Answer customer questions via telephone and in-person.
Process prescription orders for customers and collect payment.
Contact insurance carriers as needed to resolve issues with orders.
Accurately track inventory levels within the pharmacy.

work.summary: Educator at the Kumon Learning Center, located in Kaimuki.
highlights: Collaborate with students to complete homework assignments, identify lagging skills, and correct weaknesses.
Improve test scores by focusing on reading comprehension, math, and critical thinking skills through one-on-one tutoring sessions.
Utilize different strategies to complement student's learning style.

volunteer.organization: University of Hawaii at Manoa's student ACM Chapter (ACManoa)
highlights: Responsible for ACManoa’s bank account and yearly tax filings
Divide $3,000 budget across 6 different organizations totaling over 245 club members
Prepare materials for end-of-semester presentation and report about ACManoa’s activities
Served as Vice-chairperson for Pacific Asia Travel Association for Fall 2021
Served as Chairperson for Pacific Asia Travel Association for Spring 2022

volunteer.summary: Assisting Teaching Assistant for the course ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science I for Fall 2021
highlights: Provided help in conjunction with the Teaching Assistant for 60 ICS 111 students during weekly lab sessions

Hosted office hours in 3 hour intervals to provide extra assistance on an individual basisAssisted students with questions regarding homework and course material during recitation class and open hours
